messages.subject: Lego Re: [AlwaysLearning] perhaps OT- legoland
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sorry about that, we do love legos.  I think one thing I like best about them is that they span ages so well.  Older kids and adults can play with younger
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
> Very off topic... Next time, write something useful to go with your
> off-topic request so the post itself won't be off topic.
>
> Talk about how your kids use Lego,

Sorry about that, we do love legos. I think one thing I like best about them is that they span ages so well. Older kids and adults can play with younger ones very easily, building together, having a common activity. When our two youngest were first adopted, all our kids spent hours building together, bonding over legos.

> And I might have a ticket. Marty got the legoland magazine
> yesterday. Did you read fine print to see if one family can use more
> than one freebie ticket?

One ticket per paying adult, was my understanding.

messages.subject: Lego Re: [AlwaysLearning] perhaps OT- legoland
messages.msgSnippet: Very off topic...   Next time, write something useful to go with your off-topic request so the post itself won t be off topic. Talk about how your kids use
messages.messageBody:
Very off topic... Next time, write something useful to go with your
off-topic request so the post itself won't be off topic.

Talk about how your kids use Lego, or if you've been to Legoland tell
what was coolest about it, and then I won't care about the request,
but I really don't want the list to turn to side discussions.

And I might have a ticket. Marty got the legoland magazine
yesterday. Did you read fine print to see if one family can use more
than one freebie ticket?

Marty went to Legland with a group of homeschoolers once. Even though
he was "old" (16?) he had a blast and told us stories for weeks, and
would talk about the photos I could find with excitement, no matter
how much time had passed.

Marty has quite a bit of nice Lego, and there were visiting kids
recently who were excited to see his Viking ship all put together, and
they played with it for a while, and augmented it a bit, but Marty
doesn't mind.

Sandra

messages.messageBody:
Which issue was it in?

~Katherine
